revised_title: Discovery of True Teeth in Young Ornithorhynchus Paradoxus
tldr: The author discovered true teeth in a young Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, providing evidence of their ancestral nature and suggesting that they may also be present in Echidna. The teeth's structure and development are similar to those of higher mammals, indicating their evolutionary significance.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
